alert.note: Alert for Blount Smoky Mountains; NW Blount (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 12:51PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Blount County through 215 PM EDT... At 150 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Maryville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Maryville, Alcoa, Louisville, Rockford, Eagleton Village, Townsend, Clover Hill, Walland, Happy Valley and Wildwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
